intro: Turetta, commonly known as the false heather, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Turetta typically thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
